1324477728180051968.text:

1324462924778393601.text:

1324450730850340867.text: Smoky Valley Ranch also partners w/ the @KSForestService to assist with Prescribed Fire projects and I've been pleased to support these efforts to safely accomplish over 3,000 acres of prescribed fire treatments on the property.

1324450728186970112.text:
📍Bordering Little Jerusalem Badlands State Park is Smoky Valley Ranch - our next stop.
 
Owned & operated by @nature_kansas, Smoky Valley Ranch has worked w/ @USDA_NRCS for 20+ years to protect grassland through grazing management plans. https://t.co/RazawT46xR

1324422950339158016.text: It's also home to the largest population of Great Plains wild buckwheat, only found in the chalk bluffs prairie of western Kansas.

1324422948279693313.text:
📍Our next stop is the Little Jerusalem Badlands State Park owned by @nature_kansas.

1324402961548824578.text:

1251230234906689536.text:

1205653984888930304.text: I’ve seen no evidence that President Trump should be removed from office.

1205653983378972673.text: Under the Constitution, the role of a Senator is to act as a juror. Therefore, unless and until the House impeaches President Trump, and the Senate has concluded its review of the impeachment charges, it is inappropriate for me to say how I would vote.

1129482616506408960.text: It is now critical that Congress quickly pass USMCA to continue to strengthen our trade relationship with our North American neighbors.

1129482615520661504.text: Not only were the steel and aluminum tariffs harmful to Kansas manufacturers, but the tariffs threatened to pose as a roadblock for the enactment of the United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement.

1129482614350536707.text: Canada and Mexico consistently rank as the number one and two export markets for Kansas and together account for over one-third of our state’s overall exports.

1129482613381582850.text: I applaud the administration for reaching an agreement to lift the steel and aluminum tariffs on Canada and Mexico, and eliminating those countries’ retaliatory tariffs targeted primarily at U.S. agriculture.

1129476452322357248.text: While our producers will continue to face higher tariffs when exporting beef to Japan compared to foreign competitors, I am hopeful this lays the groundwork for a bilateral agreement with Japan on agricultural trade. Full statement: https://t.co/olM0f6kHoo

1064685420238245890.text: I want to thank the thousands of Kansans who took the time to attend my Kansas Listening Tours and share their thoughts, concerns and ideas with me this Congress. These important townhall meetings continue to shape the work I am privileged do in Washington, D.C.

1064676772422316032.text: However, over these 105 townhall meetings – and the 1,312 townhall meetings I’ve held throughout my time in Congress – one thing always remains the same: the Kansans I meet with care deeply about our state and the future of our nation.

1064676770547474432.text: In most every meeting, Kansans have acknowledged the contentious nature of politics today & I felt this tension during many of my Listening Tour stops. All across the state, I heard from Kansans, who agreed and disagreed with me, about the issues most important to them.

1064676766860697600.text: Throughout this Congress, I have crisscrossed the 82,000+ square miles of our state, holding townhall meetings in all 105 Kansas counties. 1047995549759102976.text: ✈Improving child safety on commercial airlines. Legislation I championed is included in #FAAReauthorization, directing the FAA to review and update the contents of emergency medical kids on planes – something that hasn’t been done in almost 20 years.

1047995548186415104.text: ✈Highlighting the need for talented women in the aviation workforce and making certain the FAA facilitates their recruitment. Women comprise only 4% of flight engineers, 6% of pilots & 26% of air traffic controllers – a significant untapped pool of talent for the industry.

1047995546533855232.text: ✈Preserving the Contract Weather Observers program. In recent years, the FAA has proposed eliminating the CWO program at airports such as @FlyICT. I’ve fought against elimination of the CWO program to preserve the highest levels of safety at airports.

1047995544793174016.text: ✈Increasing fairness & reducing regulation for general aviation projects.

1047995543383932928.text: ✈Reauthorizing the FAA’s Essential Air Service Program, which connects rural airports to the national system. Kansas airports currently participating in the EAS program include @GCKAirport, @FlyHays and @SalinaAirport. This bill reauthorizes the EAS program for five years.

1047995541869789184.text: ✈The ability to build or replace contract towers and secure needed equipment to help enhance air traffic safety at Kansas airports, such as @FlyMHK and @HutchGov.

1047995538535342080.text: ✈Strengthening the Federal Contract Tower Program. Kansas is home to eight contract air traffic control towers, which provide important safety services at small airports nationwide in a cost-effective manner – saving the FAA approximately $200 million annually.

1047995536618508289.text: ✈Establishing fair treatment of UAS by tribal governments. The #FAAReauthorization Act amends the definition of “public aircraft” to include Unmanned Aircraft Systems that are owned and operated by a tribal government.

1047995535267753984.text: ✈Acceleration of the safe integration of UAS technology. In May, @USDOT announced that @KDOTHQ was a winner of its UAS Integration Pilot Program. The IPP is a solid path forward to address airspace sovereignty & included in this bill is my language to codify & expand the IPP.

1047995533686726657.text: ✈Reducing regulatory barriers for educational use of drones. Last Congress, I was the co-lead of legislation to reduce barriers for the use of small unmanned aerial systems at institutes of higher education.

1047995532214513665.text: ✈Helping to close the skills gap in the aviation workforce. I am an original cosponsor of legislation, included in the FAA bill in its entirety, to create a pilot program within the FAA through which grants would be authorized to support technical and career education.

1047995530788397057.text: ✈Supporting advanced materials research at @WichitaState that has played a critical role in the evolution and integration of aircraft materials and technologies by continuing the FAA Center of Excellence for Advanced Materials at WSU.

1047995529421119488.text: ✈Bolstering aviation manufacturing by streamlining the aircraft certification process. These reforms will strengthen U.S. aviation sales and exports, help bring new safety technology to market and better utilize FAA and general aviation industry resources.

1039577183856087040.text: Thank you for those who watched the #LandonLecture. As I stated in my remarks, I’m committed to making certain we #NeverForget 9/11 and how it refocused us as a nation on the things that bind us together rather than pull us apart. God Bless America today and everyday.

1039554527345750016.text: May we #NeverForget September 11th, 2001. May we Never Forget the way we united in the aftermath of the attacks, as one nation under God. And may we renew our commitment to respecting one another, to working together for the common good and answering the call to serve.

1039553708093259781.text: As I stood next to a New York City congressman from Brooklyn, we saw a nation under attack. While we disagree with each other more often than not, as we stood there, we saw each other as fathers, not foes; fellow Americans, not political enemies. #LandonLecture

1039552438133510145.text: Her concern for me on that day and her efforts to make sure it was she who told our daughters their father was safe, rather than the television, is representative of a larger sacrifice that my family has made in order for me to continue to answer the calls of many. #LandonLecture

1039552436418093056.text: One of the most important calls I took that day was from my wife, Robba. Before widely used cell phones, texting and email, she had no way to reach me besides calling my main office line.

1039552226446983169.text: I felt the care and compassion of Kansans in ways that I had not before, and I am forever changed. #LandonLecture

1039552224198905856.text: On this day, the most frightening day our nation has seen in this lifetime, Kansans chose to pick up the phone and offer their assistance, their thoughts and their prayers.

1039552221749407750.text:
Earlier, I spoke about remaining in my office and answering Kansans’ telephone calls on September 11th.

Now, let me tell you what Kansans called to say: they called to ask how they could support their fellow Americans, how they could help.

1039551903896621057.text: As we now reflect on Senator McCain’s vast contributions to our nation, I intend to continue advancing his work and making certain veterans are treated with the dignity and respect they have earned and that they receive the benefits they were promised. #LandonLecture

1039550996102438914.text: The world recently mourned the passing of my friend Senator John McCain. He was an honorable man and exemplified what it means to be a great American. He used his bully-pulpit for good and allowed the injustices he’d seen throughout his life to guide his work. #LandonLecture

1039548175512686598.text: For as long as I’ve been in Congress, I’ve been explaining, “where I come from, economic development can often be whether or not there is a grocery store in town.” #LandonLecture

1039547469040893952.text: I was walking through the area where the Twin Towers once stood. Memorials had been created there among the dust and rubble, where loved ones could pay their respects. #LandonLecture

1039547466444623872.text: A few days after the September 11th attacks, I was part of the first congressional delegation to visit Ground Zero in New York City. #LandonLecture

1039545746775846912.text: I hope today to convey to the students in this room – to the next generation of engineers, mathematicians, pilots, astronauts, scientists – Kansas needs you. #LandonLecture

1039545744829702144.text: From drones to NBAF and everything in-between, industry and research need young people, and young people need opportunities. #LandonLecture

1039544416451678208.text: Plain and simple: Canadian and Mexican markets are vital to our state and both countries need to be part of a final NAFTA agreement. #LandonLecture

1039544188390522880.text: We ought to continue working to improve pre-existing trade deals, including the North American Free Trade Agreement, and re-engaging in others, such as the Trans-Pacific Partnership. #LandonLecture

1039544121319415808.text: Tough enforcement of trade rules is a good idea, especially when it comes to dealing with China, but a trade war is not. #LandonLecture

1039541688056901632.text: But I’m also going to discuss how we should “never forget” how we came together as a country to help one another after that horrific day 17 years ago. #LandonLecture

1039541685758382080.text: Today, I am going to speak to you about how 9/11 changed me as a legislator and the issues I have been called to help solve in order to make a difference in Kansas and our country. #LandonLecture

1039541464081022976.text: determined to tackle every problem I could, to seize every moment of every day to fight for not only those who were sent into harm’s way, but for our farmers, our ranchers, our teachers, our veterans, and our way of life. #LandonLecture

1039541461442801664.text: As Kansans returned to work and profoundly demonstrated that they would not be held hostage by fear, I returned to work as your representative with a new fire, a new passion and a new sense of purpose,

1039541028607418369.text: In a new way, I had a duty not only to preserve the Kansas way of life that I cared so much about, but the American way of life. #LandonLecture

1039541026606727168.text: This day 17 years ago changed me – the way I viewed public service and advocated for Kansans and our country. It broadened my prospective and deepened my resolve. #LandonLecture

1039540061665210371.text: I stood side-by-side with Chuck and we turned on the television in time to witness a second airplane crash into the South Tower of the World Trade Center. Immediately, we concluded: “This can’t be an accident.” #LandonLecture

1039540059500888064.text: I had just finished my regular morning workout when, with my colleague from New York, then-Representative @ChuckSchumer, we first heard reports of a plane crashing into a high-rise building in New York City. #LandonLecture

1039533307187392512.text: This morning at @KState, I’ll deliver the 178th Landon Lecture to share my story of September 11, 2001 and how that day broadened my perspective and changed me as a legislator. Use #LandonLecture to follow along and engage in today's discussion.

1022602327272960002.text: Trade and exports are how we earn a living in Kansas, and I reiterated this to U.S. Trade Representative Robert Lighthizer today during my Senate Appropriations subcommittee hearing. See more: https://t.co/SUXpEF7bC1

1022480337430081536.text: Trade and exports are how we earn a living in Kansas. The effects of the current tariffs are real and farmers, ranchers and our nation’s manufacturing industry cannot afford a trade war.

1022480335983063042.text: Any further escalation of the trade dispute with China that results in more tariffs will only cause harm to families, farmers, manufacturers, workers, consumers and businesses – the very people and industries that USTR is supposed to help succeed.

1022480334514995205.text: The tactics we see now – where the United States imposes tariffs, China responds, the United States threatens more tariffs, China responds and so forth – appear to have gotten China’s attention, but more tariffs cannot be the ultimate answer.

1022479947347189760.text: While I applaud the administration’s efforts to crack down on China’s unfair trade practices, I’m questioning Ambassador Lighthizer on the administration’s tactics and strategy regarding how it is negotiating with China. LIVE: https://t.co/LA4sOZZrfR

999355922907631617.text: 1⃣2⃣ We’re working hard to foster innovation within the VA. This bill creates the VA Center for Innovation, allowing the VA to develop and carry out pilot programs to explore innovative approaches to improving care, access to care and cost of care to better assist our veterans. https://t.co/PrEvACFjBz

999355919585726465.text: 1⃣1⃣ The VA is known as a high-quality provider of telemedicine, but the opportunity to expand that – especially for rural veterans or veterans needing specialty care – is one that I am pleased we incorporated into the #VAMISSIONAct. https://t.co/9NrpI8klmk

999355916720975873.text: 🔟 The #VAMISSIONAct provides additional funds to maintain the Veterans' Choice Program during the development and implementation of the new Community Care Program and removes the barrier between Choice-specific funds and other community care funds. https://t.co/08JN9HUCec

999352270822223884.text: 9⃣ Walk-in care is becoming more common. This legislation allows our veterans to receive care from local walk-in clinics, convenient-care clinics & federally-funded health centers, giving veterans the same access to non-emergent convenience care in the community as non-veterans. https://t.co/yZwcqIAuQt

999352262270050304.text: 8⃣ Representing a rural state, I am pleased the #VAMISSIONAct requires community care be paid for at critical access hospital designation Medicare rates, encouraging our rural hospitals to accept veterans into their community care program. More information ↓ https://t.co/n6XHL2uvvm

999352258952343555.text: 7⃣ #VAMISSIONAct requires market area assessments to determine where VA care is available in the community & where it excels. These assessments will provide Congress a better understanding of redundancies & what kind of care is in the best interest of the veteran. https://t.co/kkzLpIsMyV

999349216542674944.text: 6⃣ Too often veterans must return to the VA every time they need treatment stemming from the original purpose of seeking care in the community. This legislation cuts red tape by making certain an entire episode of care is treated to completion in the community. More ↓ https://t.co/dX3CVzZYac

999349212503519245.text: 5⃣ Veterans will now have the ability to appeal a decision made by the VA if they believe their VA provider is wrongly denying them access to community care – giving the veteran an additional option for recourse and putting their care decisions back in their own hands. https://t.co/Et9GF0WHej

999349209395617797.text: 4⃣ The #VAMISSIONAct reforms community care eligibility – a big win for veterans. This legislation replaces the existing, arbitrary 30-day/40-mile eligibility requirements with simply what is in the best interest of the veteran. https://t.co/DejwUqWfvS

999346219666288645.text: 3⃣ This legislation requires the VA to provide veterans a coordinator of care when they choose to utilize care in their community to ensure continuity of care and service in a timely manner, making it easier for a veteran to receive the care they need. https://t.co/pB79tmTfqI

999346213186088970.text: 2⃣ There are seven different community care programs within the VA where veterans can access care outside of the VA. These programs are consolidated into one under the #VAMISSIONAct, reducing bureaucracy and making the program easier for veterans and their providers. https://t.co/NDbkVtplTT

999346207037231105.text: 1⃣ #VAMISSIONAct makes certain the VA executes the law consistent with the intent of Congress as it develops rules & regulations to govern the new Choice program – preventing the VA from narrowing & limiting the program's ability to serve veterans as we intend & they deserve. https://t.co/RXtcTlaUh4
